result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Renner states Defendant is in Washington County Jail. 
Atty Renner states covid outbreak is sweeping the jail.

Atty Herrmann is ready to proceed but understands health concerns. 
Court will reset this matter to December.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr. Asking for trial dates. Case assigned to Branch III, clerk to contact parties. Minutes filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

3:07 PM Defendant Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Herrmann called to the stand as a witness Deputy Courtney Jacobson.
Witness has identified the defendant in court. Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received by the court.
Exhibit #1 offered to the court. Attorney Renner no objection, subject to cross examination.
Exhibit #1 received by the court.
Evidence is closed.
3:15PM - Argument by Attorney Renner.
Argument by ADA Herrmann.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
Attorney Renner acknowledges receipt of the Information ,waived reading and plead not guilty on behalf of her client.
Status scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney James Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larry Donelle Jefferson Jr not in court. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for defendant. Rights given and hearing requested. Time period waived. Defendant has court in another county today. State provides complaint to Attorney Renner. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1821 thru 22-1823

Defendant Larry D Jefferson in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order to seal - Notice of Arrest
